page.title: 03GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA 2/2
page.content:
The community originated north west of the more modern expanding village. The old settlement nestling around the Parish Church of St Mary is separate and distinct from the linear development which spreads along the old 'A.30'.
This is now by-passed by a dual carriageway which forms the trunk road into Cornwall and carries the bulk of the heavy and holiday traffic.
Several 'B' roads radiate from Tedburn, one of the most notable being to the old market town of Crediton. Another was the one time main route to Exeter which the coaches on the Exeter to Okehampton run used and which followed the ridges of the hills through the village of Whitestone.
